_header: O Jesu that madest the heavens clear
Subjects: fifteen, O’s of Christ; Christ, fifteen O’s
_description: The Fifteen O’s — nine stanzas rhyme royal

Longleat30.First Lines:
Ihesu þat madest þe heuenes clereEnlumined wiþ
                    sterres bright…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…And lede hit with þe in to þat placeWhere men may
                    se þe brightnesse of þi face
Longleat30.Note:
Final lines followed by ‘O Pater noster Aue maria / Ihesu
                    and three ruled, blank lines, with the verso also ruled and left
                    blank.
Longleat30.Attributed Title: O Pater noster Aue maria (before every stanza)

HunHM142.First Lines:
O Ihesu þat madest þe heuenes clereEnlumined wiþ
                    sterres bryght…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…And lede hit with þe in to þat placeWhere men may
                    se þe brightnesse of þi face
HunHM142.Attributed Title: Pater noster. Aue maria (before every stanza)
HunHM142.Editions:
Schulz,  Herbert. C. 
             “Middle English Texts from the ‘Bement’ Manuscript.” 
             Huntington Library Quarterly
         3 (1940): 440-65: 452-7.
